item.title: Weeknotes 19 - 25 January 2026
Weeknotes 12 - 18 January 2026
item.description: Golf and not much else this week… …felt bad about not doing other things (ie wing-SUPing) some days, but realise that’s a stupid reaction today. I spent a lot of time on something I enjoy, finding it both challenging and satisfying.

item.title: Play golf: start and stay positive
item.description: A round of golf is long… …and can become frustrating, even demoralising. Even when things have been going well it’s weirdly difficult to stay positive. Disaster can seem just around the corner.

item.title: Weeknotes 5 - 11 January 2026
Range practice 2026
item.description: My range practice has almost becomes more about warmup strategy than anything else… …because what I’m practising is the basics of contact, direction and distance. For a warmup I’ll work up the clubs (usually just odd/even irons to save time and balls) to driver.

item.title: Chipping and pitching practice 2026
item.description: My chipping and pitching practice plans are in constant development… …in part because there are two areas where I might practice that encourage the use of different intentions. Looking at the image above: one is the yellow rectangular chipping zone, the other is the practice green zone within the blue oval.

item.title: Putting practice 2026
Work and play
item.description: I have played a lot of golf since my last golf-dedicated post from July 2025… …a statement that covers range practice, social and competition rounds, because when I used the word “work” to talk about golf practice recently my coach questioned whether that description was helpful.

item.title: Weeknotes 29 December 2025 - 4 January 2026
Weeknotes 22 - 28 December 2025
Weeknotes 15 - 21 December 2025
Weeknotes 8 - 14 December 2025
item.description: Some more bits and pieces of life, which is pretty slow atm… …in part because it suddenly got hot. Luckily golf was on cooler days, but that meant it clashed with times I might have attempted to wing-SUP.

item.title: Weeknotes 1 - 7 December 2025
item.description: First of the newstyle weeknotes… …inspired by my love of reading weeknotes on The weblog of Alice Bartlett, which make me feel good about sharing bits and pieces of life without worrying that I need to entertain a reader other than me.

item.title: Mind the gap
item.description: A lot of good things happened in September, October and November… …but I didn’t get around to writing any weeknotes. In part that was because I was away quite a bit without my laptop.

item.title: Weeknotes 25 - 31 August 2025
Weeknotes 18 - 24 August 2025
Weeknotes 11 - 17 August 2025
Weeknotes 4 - 10 August 2025
Weeknotes 28 July - 3 August 2025
item.description: Went for a less travelled river walk… …to see the end of the under-the-bridge art “gallery” (pictured above). Thought I wasn’t going to get there for a bit, since there were lots of signs telling me the path was closed around Heathcote and past the yacht club, but it was all fine.

item.title: Weeknotes 21 - 27 July 2025
Golf progress summary
item.description: It’s turned cold. There was frost on the practice range this morning (shown in image above)… …but the cold doesn’t bother me. So long as it’s not windy and raining I’ve been practising.

item.title: Weeknotes 14 - 20 July 2025
Weeknotes 6 - 13 July 2025
Weeknotes 30 June - 6 July 2025
item.description: Pretty good weather this week meant more outside activities… …including a neighbourhood walk (with the pictured Bougainvillea in probably my favourite colour) being one of the sights. I also visited Booyeembara Park for the first time in years (having walked there regularly when our dog was getting old and needed short, but stimulating, walks).

item.title: New putting drill
item.description: In an effort to stop leaving putts short (or at least reduce the issue)… …I’ve been trying out a new putting drill designed to improve pace feel and confidence putting across a range of distances.

item.title: Rhythm and balance
item.description: I’ve done something like this before, thinking about setting the club off and then letting it move with its own momentum… …but this way of envisioning that process seems to work really well.

item.title: New grip process
item.description: Practice on the range convinced me I still needed to do more work on grip… …developing a better process to setup my grip and movement to address the ball. I’ve written a lot already about grip and setup processes, but things have been morphing while I’ve been playing.

item.title: Short game practice
item.description: It’s been a while since a dedicated golf update… …there’s been some weather getting in the way of practice and play. More broadly, I’ve not been feeling great (mentally), which leads to a lack of motivation and energy to practice.

item.title: Weeknotes 23 - 29 June 2025
item.description: Made the most of the sun this week, which meant… …lots of walks (view from Wireless Hill above), photographs of flowers (below), seedpods and cockatoos (on my Instagram here and here), as well as a lot of golf (practice and play).

item.title: Weeknotes 16 - 22 June 2025
Weeknotes 9 - 15 June 2025
Weeknotes 2 - 8 June 2025
item.description: Tired and sad, not sure why… …so goodbye week, hoping I feel better in the next few days. Hid from the rain. Played some trash golf (practice and competition). Saw pretty flowers (pictured) when I went for a walk.

item.title: Weeknotes 26 May - 1 June 2025
item.description: OMG the raven family is on the wing and ready to rumble… …they’re honing their flying skills, learning to “sing”, playing on the roof (in their hobnailed boots) and, presumably, stealing food from the chickens next door, etc).

item.title: Weeknotes 19 - 25 May 2025
item.description: We have had a few red-tailed black cockatoo visits for dinner now… …and I’m excited to see them each time, although they make a hell of a mess under the tree with lots of small branches falling as they eat.

item.title: Weeknotes 12 - 18 May 2025
item.description: Spent some money this week buying a graphic novel that was a PhD thesis and a great piece of art (both pictured in the image for this week)… …the first because Unflattening by Nick Sousanis sounds like a fascinating exploration of how words and images might be “inextricably linked” as “equal partners in meaning-making”, the second because it was the first piece of landscape art I’ve seen in ages that really called to me.

item.title: Driving tests
item.description: The driver is a club I can hit really well - one of my first novelty prizes was for longest drive at my grade - but it is also the one that tests my skill and nerve the most…

item.title: Weeknotes 4 - 11 May 2025
item.description: This week it’s become clear I don’t take enough photographs… …although that is, in part, because I’ve been trying to pay more attention to what I’m seeing in the moment, rather than recording what I’m seeing.

item.title: Practise, practise...
item.description: “There’s a bucket full of pain”, said the guy walking towards me with his mate as I headed to the driving range this morning… …“Don’t say that”, I replied, “we need to keep some positivity here”.

item.title: Weeknotes 28 April - 4 May 2025
Build systems
item.description: I think Joan Westenberg’s argument about backing systems over sparks is a great way to understand golf and how to improve one’s game… …so I’ve written this quick post to draw out the words that hit home for me, because Westenberg probably (certainly?

item.title: Weeknotes 21 - 27 April 2025
Process is everything
Weeknotes 14 - 20 April 2025
item.description: Filling in medical forms drains my energy as does playing trash golf, but my attempts to do things (whatever they might be) continue… …while I’ve not implemented the block method from How to Do Things I have identified a few things I’d like to do in the next few months.

item.title: Weeknotes 7 - 13 April 2025
item.description: I’m not sure what I’ve been doing with my time, other than trying to improve my golf, and I’m pretty sure I could be getting a little more done now I’ve been off work for a while…

item.title: Weeknotes 31 March - 6 April 2025
item.description: A better week than last week, with a lot of smoke towards the end, but also lower temperatures… …which meant I did get a few more things done this week (as well as playing quite a bit of golf at the course, pictured in the evening light for this week’s cover image).

item.title: Managing practice for positivity
item.description: I’ve continued to practice diligently, but with varied success… …Tuesday went badly on the driving range at first, with lots of pulls left. After moving to the other practice area for some chipping in the zone (pictured above), I returned to hit another bucket of range balls a little better.

item.title: Weeknotes 24 - 30 March 2025
item.description: I admit it. I didn’t want to write these weeknotes… …but keeping them going still seems useful. This week has been hot, with easterly winds of the type that have the potential to dry my eyes out so they burn.

item.title: Aaargh grip change
item.description: Continued regular practice chipping/pitching meant that, once again, I could move on to something new with my third golf lesson… …and, don’t get me wrong, changing my grip is an important part of this journey, but it’s so weird that during the back swing it feels like hitting the ball is a physical impossibility, except it then turns out it’s not (mostly).

item.title: Golf and goals
item.description: I’ve had a few conversations in the last week or so, most recently with my golf coach, which have made me think about goals… …in relation to golf and life more generally.

item.title: Weeknotes 17 - 23 March 2025
item.description: Took no proper photos this week, so here’s a really bad one of the river and ocean view through the gap between houses… …for a week where I caught up with people I’d not seen for months and years respectively, while not looking forward to the return of summer temperatures in a few days time.

item.title: Weeknotes 10 - 16 March 2025
Continuing to learn to hit a small ball
item.description: Regular practice, for 5 days out of 6 after my first, meant my second golf lesson was about the follow through, along with tips for practice and analysis of progress…

item.title: Patterned skirt
item.description: Finally got around to making the modified skirt for patterned materials with inset side seam pockets… …which was an easy make (easier than expected) and bodes well for a make with the more expensive material I bought recently!

item.title: Weeknotes 3 - 9 March 2025
item.description: A long weekend here that doesn’t feel that way, with lots of golf, some music and pretty skies… …that are pictured above and below. Still getting incandescently irritated with myself when I do something wrong, forget something and/or do nothing (ie procrastinate a day away).

item.title: The beginning of a new golf learning journey
Weeknotes 24 February - 2 March 2025
item.description: Good things, but personal frustration too… …as I managed to do some of the things, but not all of the things (and didn’t seem to be able to let go of irritation with myself as the week moved by).

item.title: The blog questions challenge
item.description: I’d never get tagged directly (because I’m pretty sure no-one doing the challenge knows I’m writing), but at least I can respond to the open call… …from localghost (who I read)!

item.title: Weeknotes 17 - 23 February 2025
item.description: Art, art and there should have been more art (but the opening times didn’t work for me), lunch, beach and golf… …so I did well this week, but am annoyed I missed David Spencer’s Pentimento in Fremantle.

item.title: Weeknotes 10 - 16 February 2025
item.description: Not a fantastic week, with the car breaking down (and me with it, to some extent)… …but I’m feeling much better and the car is fixed, so things are looking up again.

item.title: Weeknotes 3 - 9 February 2025
item.description: Hot and humid days have meant I was lacking in energy, but I did flop about in the ocean with a windsurfer two more times. I met this shield bug in the park where I recovered the second time…

item.title: Drafting patterns and sewing skirts
item.description: Since I can’t find skirts I like, and my wear-all-the-time skirts are wearing out too much to fix easily, I have finally drafted a pattern and made my own… …the first being a wearable toile (cheap material, stitched and re-stitched to fit).

item.title: Weeknotes 27 January - 2 February 2025
Weeknotes 20 - 26 January 2025
item.description: Don’t get too excited. I don’t kitesurf (since a scary experience just after I finished lessons) and I haven’t yet managed to get back on the windsurfer. I did make it to the beach…

item.title: Weeknotes 13 - 19 January 2025
item.description: For some reason this was a week dominated by irritability… …and I’m not absolutely sure why. It might have something to do with wanting to feel I’m improving my golf game (but still only managing to play well for half any given round).

item.title: Weeknotes 6 - 12 January 2025
item.description: A week in which it turned out that watching golf (ie walking the course with the players) is just as tiring physically as playing golf… This week there was a professional competition at my club, so I got the chance to play another great local course for free (because we get offered alternative tee times elsewhere when we can’t access our own course).

item.title: Weeknotes 30 December 2024 - 5 January 2025
item.description: The first of the new look weeknotes as we move into the new year… Three walks this week, plus “a good walk spoiled” (ie a game of golf, as in the quotation commonly misattributed to Mark Twain).

item.title: Re-visioning weeknotes
item.description: Entering the new year with a new plan for weeknotes… Although I enjoyed writing my first few weeknote instalments last year, they got harder (or less pleasurable?) to write each week.

item.title: What's with the weeknotes?
item.description: It’s been just over a month since I left my permanent job, so it’s early days in the rest of my life… I’ve been writing weeknotes since my last week at work, which is something unexpected (for me, as someone who doesn’t write easily and has never managed to keep a diary for more than a few days) maybe that deserves some explanation, as I put a bit more thought into this website, why I decided to post weeknotes at all and how to keep going with this (and other writing).

item.title: Weeknotes 23 - 29 December 2024
item.description: Christmas is normally only celebrated in our house with food and drink, but this year we got the new lights out and decorated the owl with my Christmas golf outfit hat…

item.title: Weeknotes 16 - 22 December 2024
item.description: The frangipanis are flowering and it’s getting hotter more regularly now, so planning what to do and when is getting more important… Those plans for blogposts other than weeknotes are still just plans, so the frangipani flowers are the image of the week rather than gracing a post about the garden.

item.title: Weeknotes 9 - 15 December 2024
item.description: A week where I got some worthwhile things done, but also went onto campus and back to (unpaid) thinking and writing work too soon… Although I’m planning a post (or series of posts) about plants and the garden, I did promise pictures of the Echinopsis oxygona cactus flowers.

item.title: Weeknotes 2 - 8 December 2024
item.description: Still trying to settle into my new life. I did manage to get a few things done while also trying to chill out (and avoid feeling like I have to do all the things all at once)…

item.title: Weeknotes 24 November - 01 December 2024
item.description: My second weeknotes post - the first week of not working (not being on holiday, just not working) but with some work (which would not surprise anyone that knows me)…

item.title: Weeknotes 17-23 November 2024
item.description: My first ever weeknotes post following a momentous week - finishing up my work as a Senior Lecturer… I took this image of an iron steer decorating a gate on the way back from a long-planned beach walk.

item.title: Communicating with Robots and Bots
item.description: Originally published in 2019 on my old blog, this post has been updated in 2024 to recognise the continued presence of the MOOC Communicating with Robots and Bots… One of the most enjoyable pieces of writing (and collating of research, videos, news articles, images etc) about robots I have done occurred back in 2019.

item.title: Still not sure about the card style for this site
item.description: While I know there are lots of sites around the web that are styled using a card type layout, I think that I was probably most influenced by Will Buckingham’s blog…

item.title: Notes on creating this site
item.description: I’m creating this site using a theme that I am customising in small ways as I go. While I’m building I’m just using GitHub Pages as a server for the site.
